result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Desiree L. Stokes

records.addlTxt: Attorney Matthew Krische at $100/hr. Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments as ordered on prior orders for cases 21CT245, 21CT246, 21CT250, 22CM676. Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

9:33 AM cases 21CT246, 21CT245, 21CT250, 22CM676, 22CF1107. Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Desiree L. Stokes in court with Attorney Matthew Krische.  Court orders that County appointment be extended to 22CF1107.
Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions: 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances.

(Case called at 11:57 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Desire Stokes appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Ryan Kohler. ADA Tiffany Winter appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. Defendant updates her phone number. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 
Hearing: 10/05/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances.
